item.title: Travel Checklist
item.author: @huatuostudio
item.description: Life is simpler with a checklist. This is what I use before my travels: Travel Documents Check all your travel documentations carefully and contact your travel agencies immediately if you have any queries or problems, Itâ€™s a good idea to have separate copies of all your documents (including passports) to carry and leave a copy of your itinerary with a relative or friend at home, All names on the booking match passport names of all travellers, Frequent flyer number has been advised and used in all bookings.

item.title: Travel Bucket List
item.author: @huatuostudio
item.description: Soak in the Pamukkale thermal pools, Turkey Explore the fascinating Salar de Uyuni salt flats, Bolivia Find paradise on Palawan Island, the Philippines See the spectacular Northern Lights Discover the â€œtemple that is a cityâ€ at Angkor Wat in Cambodia Scale Japanâ€™s highest peak, Mount Fuji Take a trip into the wilderness on an African safari Ascend the arch of Sydney Harbour Bridge My story here Trek the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu

item.title: Road Trip WA
item.author: @huatuostudio
item.description: 2016 Easter. Another year and another Easter, time goes so fast. Three of us has decided to take a road trip to the Western Australia’s Southern Forest Region. We all knew the region pretty well so the trip was roughly planned and the accommodation was booked a few days before the trip. The Itinerary Itinerary Map Day 1 Leave Perth Rest at Bunbury (1.5hrs), change driver Take the National Route 1 from Bunbury to Walpole, rest at Bridgetown and Manjimup

item.title: Taiwan Impression
item.author: @huatuostudio
item.description:
Sleepless In Hong Kong

Chinese say that 4 is not a lucky number, clearly 04/04 is worse and it was totally true - I’ve had a terrible run today! ğŸ˜¢

The flight from Sydney to Hong Kong was delayed and the connecting flight from Hong Kong to Taipei left without me. :( Apparently, it was also the last flight for the day to fly over the channel. I was stranded in Hong Kong for the night with just my passport and a wallet in my bag. Note to self, I should always put an extra pair of undies in my carry on!

This is part of the fun of traveling - dealing with problems on the go, regardless how well I planned for weeks before the trip. :) I actually have never been left stranded with no luggage before. Sigh, there is always a first hey. I started to wonder what else could go wrong now.

After some negotiation, the airline put me in theÂ Hong Kong SkyCity Marriott Hotel. I’d gave it 5 stars for the facility and the service! It was 12am when I checked in and I have to get up in 5 hours. I planned to watch some movies but after a hot shower, I pretty much passed out. ğŸ˜ƒ

item.title: RSPCA Pet Quiz Website
item.author: @huatuostudio
item.description: I’m giving myself a ğŸŒŸ for finishing a little volunteer project for RSPCA (AU) ACT. :-) The idea is to create a website that contains a Pet Quiz where people answer a few questions to find out what kind of pet is the best suitable for them. The logic for the website is pretty simple so I kept the design simple and clean too. The website is going to be used on iPads in RSPCA ACT’s booth at this year’s Florida (URL: http://rspcapetquiz.

item.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb
item.author: @huatuostudio
item.description: The Experience John has bought me a ticketÂ for a full 3 hours ofÂ Sydney Harbour Bridge ClimbÂ for my birthday this year (thank you John!! ğŸ’• ). I have to say that I have always thought the bridge climb is an overpriced tourist thing. Why would I ever do that if I live here?! :) Nevertheless, I was excited to wake up at 3am to get ready for the bridge climb.
